alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 23 at 11:45PM MDT until October 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches with the greatest amounts shifting to the eastern Sawatch Range. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Sawatch Mountains Above 11000 Feet, La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Feet and Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, anA cold front will move down the plains this evening, bringing much cooler air to the district. Lingering rain and showers will continue through the overnight over the mountains and by tomorrow afternoon there will be scattered rain and snow showers over the southern plains and the Raton Mesa. Minimal impacts are expected. Another shot at more snow is possible later this week from Thursday through Friday, but there is still some uncertainty of the storm track. Smoke dispersion tomorrow afternoon will be Very Good over the Wet Mountain Valley, the San Luis Valley, and the far eastern plains, but the rest of the region will have Poor to Fair smoke dispersion. d water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
